Description: Fragment (mended from two) preserving full profile, with handle root of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim and ring foot; interior glazed save for band at rim; exterior: black band on rim and top of shoulder; wall reserved; band on lower wall and outside of foot; underside of foot reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the profile and decoration find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 11. Very few Type 11 cups were found at Naukratis and Schlotzhauer suggests that these may have been made in specific workshops that rarely exported vases to Naukratis. The place of production of Type 11 South Ionian cups is determined as Miletus based on the results of NAA analysis carried out by Hans Mommsen, Bonn on another sherd (British Museum 1886,0401.570) from Naukratis and of same shape, decoration, and fabric. The number in Petrie's catalogue, 249, is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd. Tem(enos) AΠ in pencil.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 249)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 663, no. 210)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.158) (Phase 3)
